name.pehl.gwt.piriti.client.xml
Interface XmlReader<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type
public interface XmlReader<T>

Interface for converting an XML document / element to an instance of T or a list of Ts. The implementation for this interface is generated using deferred binding. All fields of T which are annotated with XmlField are handled by the generated XmlReader implementation. If the xpath expression behind XmlField returns some data != null the relevant field is assigned with the converted value, otherwise the field remains unchanged.

Please note that the annotated fields in T must not be private!

The setup of the XmlReader is inspired by the UiBinder and is typically specified as an inner class: 

 pubilc SmartYakizakanaState
 {
     interface Reader extends XmlReader<SmartYakizakanaState> {}
     public static final Reader XML = GWT.create(Reader.class);
     
     // The fields of this POJO annotated with XmlField.
 }
An XML document can then be converted to an instance of SmartYakizakanaState by calling 
 Document document = ...;
 SmartYakizakanaState sys = SmartYakizakanaState.XML.readSingle(document);

Version:
$LastChangedRevision: 46 $
Author:
$LastChangedBy: harald.pehl $

Method Detail

readSingle

T readSingle(Document document)
Convert the data in the specified document to an instance of T according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
document - The XML document used as input
Returns:
An instance of T with the mapped XML data or null if the document was null.

readSingle

T readSingle(Element element)
Convert the data in the specified element to an instance of T according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
element - The XML element used as input
Returns:
An instance of T with the mapped XML data or null if the element was null.

readList

List<T> readList(Document document,
                 String xpath)
Convert the data in the specified document to a list Ts according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
document - The XML document used as input
xpath - An xpath expression which should result in a list of elements which in turn are used to generated the instances of T
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped XML data or an empty list if the document was null.

readList

List<T> readList(Element element,
                 String xpath)
Convert the data in the specified element to a list Ts according to the annotated fields in T.

Parameters:
document - The XML element used as input
xpath - An xpath expression which should result in a list of elements which in turn are used to generated the instances of T
Returns:
A list of T instances with the mapped XML data or an empty list if the element was null.
